question_stem.en: A 53-year-old man is evaluated for right hand discomfort. A month ago, the patient started to experience an intermittent pins-and-needles sensation in his right hand that is worse at night. He has no neck pain or history of trauma. The patient has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for 20 years and has worked as an accountant for the past 30 years. On physical examination, there is loss of sensation over the right fifth digit. There is no swelling, redness, or warmth of the hand.
question_stem.zh: 一名53岁男性因右手不适就诊。一个月前，患者开始出现右手的间歇性针刺感，夜间加重。他没有颈部疼痛或外伤史。该患者每天吸一包香烟，持续20年，并且过去30年一直从事会计工作。体格检查显示，右侧第五指感觉丧失，手部无肿胀、发红或发热。

question.en: The patient is most likely to have weakness of which of the following movements?
question.zh: 患者最有可能出现以下哪种运动的无力？

explanation.en:
The ulnar nerve {{exhibit_1}} originates from the medial cord of the brachial plexus, courses with the brachial artery in the upper arm, and enters the forearm after passing posterior to the medial epicondyle of the humerus (cubital tunnel). It innervates the flexor carpi ulnaris (wrist flexion and adduction) and the medial portion of the flexor digitorum profundus before entering the wrist through Guyon canal (between the hook of the hamate and pisiform). In the hand, the superficial branch of the ulnar nerve provides cutaneous innervation to the fifth digit, medial half of the fourth digit, and the hypothenar eminence. The deep motor branch supplies most of the intrinsic muscles of the hand.

The ulnar nerve is most commonly injured at the elbow due to chronic compression (eg, working for prolonged periods at a desk) or trauma (eg, medial epicondyle fracture). Ulnar neuropathy at the elbow usually presents with discomfort and loss of sensation and/or paresthesia in the ulnar distribution. Severe injury can also result in impaired flexion and adduction of the wrist along with finger weakness or clumsiness. The nerve can also be injured more distally at the wrist as it runs through Guyon canal; injury at this level results in more pronounced clawing of the fourth and fifth digits (ulnar claw) due to sparing of the flexor digitorum profundus.

(Choices A and E) Radial nerve injury (eg, crutch palsy, midshaft humerus fracture) can result in weakness in elbow and/or wrist extension in addition to sensory loss over the posterior arm, dorsolateral hand, and dorsal thumb.

(Choice B) Axillary nerve injury (eg, anterior shoulder dislocation, surgical neck of humerus fracture) can present with loss of sensation over the lateral upper arm and weakness in shoulder abduction (eg, deltoid weakness).

(Choice C) Proximal median nerve injury (eg, subcondylar humerus fracture) can result in impaired flexion and abduction of the wrist, flexion of the second and/or third digit, and flexion or opposition of the thumb along with palmar sensory loss involving the first 3 digits.

Educational objective:
Ulnar nerve injury most commonly occurs at the elbow (eg, compression due to resting arm on a hard surface for prolonged periods) and usually presents with discomfort and sensory loss and/or paresthesia in the fifth digit, medial half of the fourth digit, and the hypothenar eminence. In severe injury, patients can also have impaired wrist flexion and adduction along with finger weakness or clumsiness. {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}} {{exhibit_7}} {{exhibit_8}}
explanation.zh:
尺神经 {{exhibit_1}} 起源于臂丛的内侧束，与肱动脉一起在肱骨上臂走行，并在通过肱骨内上髁后方（肘管）后进入前臂。它支配尺侧腕屈肌（腕屈曲和内收）和指深屈肌的内侧部分，然后通过Guyon管（钩骨和豌豆骨之间）进入腕部。在手部，尺神经浅支为第五指、第四指的内侧半部和鱼际提供皮肤感觉。深支支配手部的大部分内在肌。

尺神经最常在肘部因慢性压迫（例如，长时间在办公桌前工作）或外伤（例如，肱骨内上髁骨折）而受损。肘部尺神经病变通常表现为不适和感觉丧失和/或尺神经分布区的感觉异常。严重损伤也可能导致腕屈曲和内收受损以及手指无力或笨拙。神经也可能在腕部远端通过Guyon管时受损；该水平的损伤会导致第四和第五指出现更明显的爪状畸形（尺爪），因为指深屈肌得以保留。

（选项A和E）桡神经损伤（例如，拐杖麻痹、肱骨中段骨折）可能导致肘部和/或腕伸肌无力，以及后臂、手背外侧和拇指背侧的感觉丧失。

（选项B）腋神经损伤（例如，肩关节前脱位、肱骨外科颈骨折）可表现为上臂外侧感觉丧失以及肩外展无力（例如，三角肌无力）。

（选项C）近端正中神经损伤（例如，髁下肱骨骨折）可导致腕屈曲和外展受损、第二和/或第三指屈曲，以及拇指屈曲或对掌，以及累及前3个手指的掌侧感觉丧失。

教育目标：
尺神经损伤最常发生在肘部（例如，由于长时间将手臂靠在坚硬的表面上而引起的压迫），并且通常表现为第五指、第四指内侧半部和鱼际的不适和感觉丧失和/或感觉异常。在严重损伤中，患者还可能出现腕屈曲和内收受损以及手指无力或笨拙。 {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}} {{exhibit_6}} {{exhibit_7}} {{exhibit_8}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of ulnar nerve anatomy, function, and common injury patterns leading to specific motor and sensory deficits. It requires correlating the patient's symptoms (paresthesia in the fifth digit) with the expected motor weakness (wrist adduction) associated with ulnar nerve damage. 

To solve this question, recall the ulnar nerve's innervation pattern and the muscles it controls. Recognize that sensory loss in the fifth digit and impaired wrist adduction are characteristic of ulnar nerve pathology, often due to compression at the elbow.
summary.zh:
此题考察对尺神经解剖、功能和常见损伤模式的了解，这些损伤模式会导致特定的运动和感觉缺陷。它要求将患者的症状（第五指的感觉异常）与尺神经损伤相关的预期运动无力（腕内收）相关联。

要解决这个问题，请回忆尺神经的支配模式及其控制的肌肉。认识到第五指的感觉丧失和腕内收受损是尺神经病变的特征，通常是由于肘部的压迫。
